column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Diy_coref|

#Text=[0169] An advantage of the nanostructured films of the present invention is the ability to promote adhesion of the endo-graft to the aorta wall, and simultaneously promotes endothelial growth into to the endo-graft.
#Text=[0170] Of course, high adhesive force and enhanced tissue integration are only important if the coating is also hemocompatible.
#Text=Hemocompatibility refers to how the device interacts with blood and its constituent elements.
#Text=The less the nanostructured film is thrombus generating (or clot forming) on its surface, the more suitable it is for uses in aneurysm repair, Hanson S.
#Text=R. et al.
#Text="Blood Coagulation and Blood-Materials Interactions", In: Biomaterials Science--An Introduction to Materials In Medicine, Ratner, B.
#Text=D.
#Text=(ed), pp. 193-200, Academic Press, (1996), the contents of which are hereby incorporated herein by reference and discloses suitable materials for hemocompatibility.
#Text=Silicon dioxide (glass) is considered to be highly clot forming, and therefore has poor hemocompatibility.

#Text=According to the present invention, the van der Waals interactions are relatively independent of the composition of the nanowires, thus allowing for the independent tailoring of the hemocompatibility properties.
#Text=This provides flexibility in use for a biostable and hemocompatible coating.
#Text=For aneurysm uses, the coating must be equivalent in hemocompatibility to the currently used Nitinol endo-graft.
#Text=[0171] The present invention contemplates coatings of hemocompatible materials known in the art such aspyrolytic carbon and TiO.sub.2 on the nanostructures (nanowires or nanotubes).
#Text=TiO.sub.2 is preferred in one embodiment.
#Text=Techniques for coating various materials are known in the art.
#Text=Chemical vapor deposition (CVD), e-beam evaporation or atomic layer deposition are non limiting examples.
#Text=Atomic layer deposition (ALD) is a preferred technology for depositing thin conformal layers of material at low temperature.
#Text=With ALD, complex structures can be coated to create heterostructures.
#Text=The outer layer is referred as a shell and the overall architecture is referred to as a core-shell architecture, see for example Ferguson J.
#Text=D., et al.
#Text="TiO2 Atomic Layer Deposition on ZrO2 Particles Using Alternating Exposures of TiCl4 and H2O", Applied Surface Science, (226), pp. 393-404, (2004).
#Text=This process is conformal even when coating structures with very high aspect ratios such as nanowires.
#Text=This conformality comes from the layer by layer deposition process.

#Text=To add a shell (herein, a non-limiting example of TiO.sub.2 is set forth) on a nanowire by this method, generally begins by adsorbing a layer of a titanium containing precursor, such as TiCl.sub.4. until the wire structure is substantially saturated with precursor.
#Text=This exposure to the point of saturation is what makes end coating conformal and pinhole free.
#Text=After purging the vessel, the next reactive species is introduced.
#Text=For TiO.sub.2 synthesis this would be H.sub.2O.
#Text=HCl(g) and TiO.sub.2(s) are end products of this reaction.
#Text=Again, the step is performed to saturation to ensure conformatility.
#Text=This cycle can be continued numerous times to attain a TiO.sub.2 film of desired thickness.
#Text=[0172] The shape memory of Nitinol is a key property that makes it very amenable for use in medical devices.
#Text=Cold working--the temperature at which the shape of the metal is fixed--is usually around 500.degree.
#Text=C. to 650.degree.
#Text=C.
#Text=Wire synthesis is done at a temperature above the eutectic point of gold and silicon, between 360.degree.
#Text=C. and 550.degree.
#Text=C.
#Text=Disilane may be used as a silicon precursor to enhance wire growth at lower temperatures approaching the eutectic point of gold and silicon.

#Text=[0173] In another embodiment of the present invention, multiple pieces or strips of nanostructured surfaces may be applied to the patient to treat aneurysm thus allowing for overlap and increased positional accuracy.
